intro: Pycreus chekiangensis, commonly known as the Chinese windflower, is a rare and striking plant native to China. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, saucer-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas and prefers cool, moist environments. Its foliage consists of palmately lobed leaves, and it is known for its ornamental value in horticulture. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
